column1: Dear Sir or Madam, With reference to your advertisment regarding the musical show "Over the rainbow" I am writing to you with the intention of giving you an impression of our experiences attending the above-mentioned show.

column2: We were disappointed to realize that not Danny Brook but a different actor played one of the main characters.

column2: Honestly it was a less impressive performance than we had expected.

column2: According to your advertisement the play should have started at 19:30.

column2: Unfortunately there was an unexplained delay of 45 minutes.

column2: The audience had to sit and wait until 20:15.

column2: What made the situation worse is that no explanation for the delay was given; not even an apology.

column2: We had been told that discounts on the ticket prices were available but on the evening of the show no discounts or special offers whatsoever were offered.

column1: After the show we had intended to visit your theatre restaurant, which was - to our surprise - closed because of the  delay!

column2: Honestly for us it was not that "perfect evening out".

column2: We would like to ask you if there is any chance of getting our money back  or if you can offer any other alternative for our convenience?
